chart.title: Greenhouse gas emissions per kilogram of food product
chart.subtitle: [Greenhouse gas emissions](#dod:ghgemissions) are measured in kilograms of [carbon dioxide-equivalents](#dod:carbondioxideequivalents). This means non-CO₂ gases are weighted by the amount of warming they cause over a 100-year timescale.

GHG emissions per kilogram (Poore & Neme.citationShort: – processed by Our World in Data
GHG emissions per kilogram (Poore & Neme.citationLong: – processed by Our World in Data. “Greenhouse gas emissions per kilogram” [dataset]. Poore, J., & Nemecek, T. (2018). Reducing food’s environmental impacts through producers and consumers. Science. [original data].
